cotton_details.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy fiber that grows in protective cases around the seeds of the cotton plant. It is one of the most important commercial crops worldwide, used primarily in the textile industry.
cotton_details.uses: Textiles, Clothing, Bedding, Medical supplies, Industrial products (e.g., canvas, upholstery)

prerequisites.soil: Well-drained soil with good moisture retention, typically sandy loam or clay loam
prerequisites.climate: Warm temperatures (around 70°F to 95°F or 21°C to 35°C), plenty of sunshine, and moderate rainfall (around 20 to 40 inches annually)
prerequisites.frost_free_period: Cotton requires a frost-free growing season of at least 160 to 200 days.
prerequisites.water: While cotton is drought-tolerant, it requires sufficient water during critical growth stages, especially flowering and boll development.
prerequisites.space: Adequate spacing between plants for air circulation and sunlight penetration, typically planted in rows with spacing ranging from 30 to 40 inches apart.
